availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Otis Seth Tenney (Mount Sterling, Montgomery County, Kentucky, attorney and soldier - Major 2nd Battalion Mtd. Rifles (C.S.A.) )

body.p: Mount Sterling, Montgomery County, Kentucky, attorney and soldier. Son of Seth Tenney and EstherTenney. New Hampshire native. Married to Junia Warner Tenney in New Castle County, Delaware, on May 18, 1848. Father of Lilly Tenney, Anna Tenney, and Harriet Tenney. Attorney in Mount Sterling, Montgomery County, Kentucky, in 1860. Served in the 2nd Battalion Kentucky Mounted Rifles as a major from March 12, 1862 to March 6, 1863.

ab.bibl:

Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records (1852-1910), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll 994049, Montgomery County Births.
Kentucky Death Certificates, 1911-1965, Kentucky Office of Vital Statistics, KDLA, Frankfort, KY, File 7398.
